nodes.name: Calculator
nodes.notes: This toolCalculator node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Create New Time Entry

parameters.toolDescription: Call this workflow whenever you need to work with Clockify for create a new time entry.

values.name: logDescription
values.description: Description of the time log entry

values.name: endTime
values.description: Represents an end date of the time log in yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format.

values.name: projectId
values.description: Represents project unique identifier across the system.

values.name: startTime
values.description: Represents a start date of the time log in yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format.

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: GetClientsTool

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool whenever you need to get or filter clients on Clockify, especially if you need to find client id by name.

values.name: name
values.description: Filters client results that matches with the string provided in their client name.

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Get All Time Entries

parameters.toolDescription:
Call this tool whenever you need to get time entries on Clockify for a given user identified by its user Id (not name).
By default fetch entries from the last month if no dates are provided.

values.name: startTime
values.description: Represents start date in yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format. Optional

values.name: endTime
values.description: Represents end date in yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format. Optional

values.name: userId
values.description: Id of the user that is logged in, for which we are retrieving time logs

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Current loggedin user

parameters.toolDescription: Gel the current logged in user that you are operating from. Use it to get user profikle information, especially its id, email, name etc.

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: GetProjectsTool

parameters.toolDescription:
Call this tool whenever you need to get projects on Clockify. 
This is a tool to use if you want to find all projects and project ids for the logged in user.

Optionally you can filter projects by clients or by project names.

values.name: projectName
values.description: Project name; not project ID; not client ID; can be empty

values.name: clientId
values.description: Client unique identifier, this is not a name of the client; so if you fail you need to try again with client id; can be empty

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Update Time Entry

parameters.toolDescription: Call this workflow whenever you need to work with Clockify for update an existing time entry.

values.name: logDescription
values.description: Description of the time log entry

values.name: endTime
values.description: Represents an end date of the time log in yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format.

values.name: projectId
values.description: Represents project unique identifier across the system.

values.name: startTime
values.description: Represents a start date of the time log in yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ format.

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Delete Time Entry

parameters.toolDescription: Call this workflow whenever you need to work with Clockify for deleating an existing time entry.

nodes.notes: This toolHttpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: DateConverter

parameters.name: DateToMilisecondsConvertorTool
parameters.jsCode:
// Example: convert the incoming query to uppercase and return it
return (new Date(query)).getTime()
parameters.description:
Call this tool to convert dates from format to miliseconds.
Example 2024-12-02T21:04:23.623Z date is converted into time miliseconds.

this ideally is combinated with calculator to calculate duration periods.

nodes.notes: This toolCode node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: ClockifyBlockia

options.systemMessage:
=You are an smart assistant assisting engineers in the time logging management on Clockify for an agency called Blockia Labs using conversational chat system. Be precise and concise, you are engineers best friend copilot.
Your goals is to guide and help engineers in the logging process; by proactively guiding them one step again in the process and giving them options and proactive guidance, not passively waiting only on instructions.

Note that todays day is {{ $now.toUTC() }}

For date duration calculation use the date convertor tool along with the calculator.
Use step by step guidance and reasoning for this process.

For creates, updates and delete operations always double confirm with the user. Especially when deleting, make the confirmation one by one since deleting is critical ops.

Make sure the descriptions are checked, ethic and gramatically correct. 
Make sure there is no overlap in time entries or logging when one user is working on more projects at the same time. 
Return a simple mardown resposne (no bold or ****)

nodes.notes: This agent node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation 2

parameters.content:
# ClockifyBlockiaWorkflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: ClockifyBlockiaWorkflow. This workflow processes data and performs automated tasks.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 35
- **Node Types**: 11
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- **Calculator**: toolCalculator
- **Create New Time Entry**: toolHttpRequest
- **GetClientsTool**: toolHttpRequest
- **Get All Time Entries**: toolHttpRequest
- **Current loggedin user**: toolHttpRequest
- **GetProjectsTool**: toolHttpRequest
- **Update Time Entry**: toolHttpRequest
- **Delete Time Entry**: toolHttpRequest
- **DateConverter**: toolCode
- ... and 25 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
